PRISM, Privacy, and Room 641A

by Mauricio Rivera

STUFD FFFDSS\

My dad worked during so many AT&T eras/permutations that its really hard to keep track. It started as the original Ma Bell AT&T, was split up in a 1984 antitrust case, became Pacific Telesis, then Pac Bell which was aquired by SBC (formerly Southwestern Bell). SBC eventually acquired the original divested AT&T to become AT&T once again. One of his many offices was 611 Folsom Street in San Francisco, which housed the now infamous Room 641A. My dad worked during so many AT&T eras/permutations that its really hard to keep track. —December 15, 2013
